summary: Feature request to allow importing Node's built-in `buffer` module in workflows. Currently all builtin modules are blocked; user needs buffer for domain type conversion logic and believes it's deterministic and safe.
userImpact: Users who need Node's buffer module for domain type conversion in workflows are blocked and must find workarounds.
rootCause: All builtin modules are disallowed to maintain determinism and support multi-runtime compatibility (Deno, browser, etc).
proposedFix: Provide an exemption for buffer module similar to the existing exemption for assert, or allow users to load polyfills from Webpack bundler.
workaround: Load appropriate polyfills from Webpack bundler instead of using Node's native buffer.
resolutionDetails: Team decided not to support Node's Buffer API out-of-the-box to maintain compatibility with other JavaScript runtimes (Deno, browser). Users should use polyfills instead.
keyQuote: It's preferable not to provide out-of-the-box support for Node's Buffer API...we encourage users to load appropriate polyfills from their Webpack bundler.
